programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Houston (23-4, 15-1) won six-straight games behind the top scoring defense in the country, allowing 57.7 ppg; Texas Tech (21-6, 12-4) is 14-2 at home behind JT Toppin, and beat the Cougars, 82-81, in OT on Feb. 1 behind Chance McMillian.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Kansas (18-9, 9-7) is 3-7 on the road, but defeated the Buffaloes, 71-59, on Feb. 11 behind 19 points and nine rebounds from Hunter Dickinson; Colorado (11-16, 2-14) won two of its last three games, and is 10-6 at home this season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 2 Duke (24-3, 15-1) won four straight behind Cooper Flagg, who is second in the ACC with 19.5 ppg, and beat the Hurricanes, 89-54, on Jan. 14 behind 25 points from Kon Knueppel; Miami (6-21, 2-14) has all six wins at home, going 6-9.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special

programme.desc: Kansas State beat Baylor, 58-55, in their lone meeting of the 2023-24 season in Jan. 2024, led by 16 points from each of Serena Sundell, Gabby Gregory and Eliza Maupin; the Bears' Bella Fontleroy had 12 points while Aijha Blackwell added 11 rebounds.

programme.title: UFC Main Event
programme.desc: Jorge Masvidal (34-13), who is coming off the fastest knockout victory in UFC history after defeating Ben Askrem on July 6 in five seconds, takes on The Ultimate Fighter 5 lightweight winner Nate Diaz (20-11) for the "BMF" title in the main event.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Baylor (16-11, 8-8) dropped five of its last eight, but is 3-0 against the Bearcats after a 68-48 win on Jan. 7 behind 18 points from both Norchad Omier and VJ Edgecombe; Cincinnati (16-11, 6-10) won four of its last six, and is 11-4 at home.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 24 Mississippi State (19-8, 7-7) won two of its last three games, both coming against ranked opponents; No. 6 Alabama (22-5, 11-3) leads the country in scoring at 90.8 ppg behind Mark Sears, and won its last seven meetings with the Bulldogs.

programme.title: Good Guy/Bad Guy
programme.desc: UFC heavyweight and light heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier and UFC Hall of Fame member Chael Sonnen break down the latest from around the MMA world, recapping recent marquee events, the latest injury updates and guest interviews.

programme.title: UFC Main Event
programme.desc: Zhang Weili (20-1) defended her UFC Women's Strawweight Championship for the first time since beating Jessica Andrade for it at Fight Night 157 as she went up against Joanna Jedrzejczyk (16-3) in the main event of UFC 248 in a memorable bout.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Ole Miss (19-8, 8-6) lost its last two games; No. 1 Auburn (25-2, 13-1) is 12-1 at home behind a top-10 scoring offense, and won its last seven meetings with the Rebels after a 92-82 win on Feb. 1 behind 20 points and 12 rebounds from Johni Broome.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Texas (16-11, 5-9) dropped four of its last five games despite Tre Johnson, who leads the SEC in scoring with 20.2 ppg; Arkansas (16-11, 5-9) defeated the Longhorns, 78-70, on Feb. 5 behind 24 points from Johnell Davis and 14 from Adou Thiero.

programme.title: So Damn Close
programme.desc: The 2024 Ambetter Health 400 made sure the follow-up to the opening Daytona 500 would be a memorable one, as Daniel Suarez, Ryan Blaney and Kyle Busch would put together the closest three-wide photo finish in NASCAR Cup Series history.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Michigan (20-6, 12-3) had its six-game win streak snapped by Michigan State, 75-62; Nebraska (17-10, 7-9) is 10-3 at home behind Brice Williams, who is top five in Big Ten scoring with 19.4 ppg, and won both meetings with the Wolverines last season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Michigan (20-6, 12-3) had its six-game win streak snapped by Michigan State, 75-62; Nebraska (17-10, 7-9) is 10-3 at home behind Brice Williams, who is top five in Big Ten scoring with 19.4 ppg, and won both meetings with the Wolverines last season.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: William Byron became only the fourth driver to win back-to-back Daytona 500 races after taking the opener over Tyler Reddick; Daniel Suarez averaged 115.398 mph en route to his win last year, defeating Ryan Blaney by 0.003 seconds.

programme.desc: Insiders and journalists provide a detailed look inside all the action around the Big East, including highlights from the biggest games, discussions on relevant sports topics, previews of upcoming matchups, player profiles, and much more.

programme.title: Global Rise of Flag Football
programme.desc: Exploring the growth of flag football around the United States and the world.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: THE DAY: Atlanta 1992
programme.desc: The final race of the 1992 NASCAR season was one to remember as six drivers were still in contention for the series title, seven-time champion Richard Petty was taking part in his last race and was the first Winston Cup Series race for Jeff Gordon.

programme.desc: New Mexico (22-5, 14-2) had its eight-game win streak snapped by Boise State, 86-78, but beat the Aztecs, 62-48, on Jan. 11 behind 16 points from Donovan Dent, who leads Mountain West scoring; San Diego State (18-7, 11-5) is 10-3 at home this season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Utah State (24-4, 14-3) won its last five meetings with the Broncos after an 81-79 win on Jan. 11 behind 18 points from Ian Martinez; Boise State (19-8, 11-5) is 12-1 at home behind Tyson Degenhart, who is second in Mountain West scoring.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Villanova (16-12, 9-8) won four of its last six, and won nine of its last 10 meetings with the Pirates after a 79-67 win on Dec. 16 behind 25 points from Eric Dixon, who leads the country with 22.9 ppg; Seton Hall (7-20, 2-14) is 5-9 at home.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The winner in the semifinal matchup between E J Tackett and Timmy Tan, as well as the victor between Tim Foy Jr. and Dom Barrett advance to compete for the top prize of $30,000; Anthony Simonsen of Las Vegas took home the title in 2024.

programme.title: Saudi Pro League Soccer
programme.desc: Al-Nassr (13-5-3) has won five of the past six meetings across all competitions, including a 2-0 triumph in Week 5, as Angelo and Cristiano Ronaldo each found the back of the net; Al-Wehda (3-4-14) is winless over its last seven league contests.

programme.title: The Pokerstars Big Game on Tour
College Basketball
programme.desc: UConn (18-8, 10-5) won four of its last six games; No. 10 St. John's (23-4, 14-2) is 16-0 at home, and defeated the Huskies, 68-62, on Feb. 7 behind 21 points from RJ Luis Jr., who is fourth in the Big East in scoring with 17.6 ppg.

programme.desc: Professional football players and Grammy award-winning musicians share inspiring messages at the Mahalia Jackson Theater of Performing Arts in New Orleans.

programme.desc: The top anglers across the country compete in a series of annual events that makes up bass fishing's most competitive league, featuring millions of dollars in prizes, tournaments taking place throughout the U.S., and coverage of all the major phases.

programme.desc: Reims advanced with a 3-2 penalty shootout victory over Bourgoin-Jallieu in the Round of 16; Angers snapped a three-match winless skid to Les Rouges et Blancs across all competitions with a 1-0 road victory in a Ligue 1 contest on Feb. 16.

programme.title: Coupe de France
programme.desc: Dunkerque advanced past Lille in the Round of 16 in a shootout, 5-4, after Kay Tejan scored the equalizer in second-half stoppage time; Abdallah Sima notched the match-winner in second-half stoppage time, as Brestois defeated Troyes, 2-1, on Feb. 4.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Colorado Rapids won the first leg matchup vs. Los Angeles FC with a 2-1 victory at Dick's Sporting Goods Park on Feb. 18, as Djordje Mihailović notched a brace in the second half; Los Angeles FC was the runner-up in the 2020 and 2023 edition.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: FC Cincinnati looks to advance to the Round of 16 after cruising to a 4-1 victory over Honduran side Motagua at Estadio José de la Paz Herrera Uclés in the first leg matchup on Feb. 19, as Pavel Bucha notched a brace with a goal in each half.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Inter Miami CF secured a 1-0 triumph over Sporting Kansas City in the first leg matchup at Children's Mercy Park on Feb. 19, as Lionel Messi found the back of the net off an assist from Sergio Busquets in the 56th minute.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Seattle Sounders FC broke a 1-1 tie with two unanswered goals in the second half to beat Guatemalan club Antigua GFC at Estadio Pensativo in the first leg matchup, 3-1, on Feb. 19, as Pedro de la Vega scored the game-winner in the 61st minute.

programme.title: Bassmaster Elite Series
programme.desc: Season begins with 2025 FXR Pro Fish Bassmaster Elite at St. Johns River, with Greg Hackney (who was 2nd at St. Johns in 2016 and 2021), Easton Fothergill, Jeff Gustafson, Jason Williamson, Justin Hammer, Takumi Ito, and Keith Combs among anglers.

programme.title: Bassmaster Elite Series
programme.desc: Season begins with 2025 FXR Pro Fish Bassmaster Elite at St. Johns River, with Greg Hackney (who was 2nd at St. Johns in 2016 and 2021), Easton Fothergill, Jeff Gustafson, Jason Williamson, Justin Hammer, Takumi Ito, and Keith Combs among anglers.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Costa Rican side Herediano and MLS club Real Salt Lake played to a scoreless draw at Estadio Nacional de Costa Rica in the first leg matchup on Feb. 19; Real Salt Lake was the runner-up to Monterrey in the 2010-11 edition of the tournament.
